guiDefinition.caption: Anisotropy_correction Cell_content_analysis Automatic_experimental_phasing Automatic_molecular_replacement Rotation_function Translation_function Packing Refinement_and_phasing Normal_mode_analysis Domain_analysis

qualifiers.toolTip: Reflections file with X-ray data (any format)
Explicit value in the absence of the sequence file for your target structure
RMSD of search model(s) to target structure
Sequence identity (as percent value) of search model(s) to target structure

qualifiers.guiLabel: VRMS perturbed upwards when estimating from ID
qualifiers.toolTip: Sequence identity (as percent value) of search model(s) to target structure, with upwards perturbabion of VRMS

qualifiers.guiLabel: VRMS perturbed downwards when estimating from ID
qualifiers.toolTip: Sequence identity (as percent value) of search model(s) to target structure, with downwards perturbabion of VRMS

The scattering power entered either as the sequence file or as the molecular weight will be multiplied by this number. Say your target consists of three identical molecules but you have specified the weight for only one of them then you should enter the value 3 here

qualifiers.guiLabel: Number of copies to search for
qualifiers.toolTip: If the target you are searching for consists of more identical molecules specify how many of these you wish to search for
Sequence file must be a plain text file, not RTF or Word document
Provide molecular weight in Daltons

The scattering power of the ASU contents entered below will be multiplied by this number. Say your target consists of three identical molecules but you specify the ASU contents of only one molecule then you should enter the value 3 here.
ID used to select ensembles as components for search should contain letters, numbers and underscores but no spaces

Phaser will normally check for consistency between individual models in an ensemble, and stop with an error message if they are sufficiently dissimilar (taking into account truncations/extensions in addition to sequence similarity). In some cases it may be desirable to turn off this feature, especially when an ensemble of models from different species is being used. (This only applies to the current ensemble.)
Toggle for the use of HETATM records in pdb file

qualifiers.guiLabel: Estimation method for rmsd from sequence identity
qualifiers.toolTip: Estimation of rmsd from sequence identity
If checked, the ensemble will be treated as a known partial solution already placed in the unit cell. No additional search will be performed on this ensemble.
RMSD of the model relative to the expected structure.
Sequence identity of the model relative to the crystallized structure.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Read variances from PDB REMARK section
qualifiers.toolTip: This can use remarks inserted by the Sculptor utility in multi-model PDB files to set the sequence identity for each model. It is only appropriate if using a single PDB file.
MTZ-format reflections file containing map coefficients
Labels for amplitude data and phases, or pre-calculated map coefficients
RMSD of the model represented by the map relative to the expected structure.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percentage coverage for two sequences to be considered in same pointgroup
Percentage identity for two sequences to be considered in same pointgroup
Percentage rmsd for two models to be considered in same pointgroup
Sample trace coordinates using all atoms, C-alpha atoms, a hexagonal grid in the atomic volume or use an automatically determined choice
Target for number of points in hexagonal grid
Allowed range below Target for number of points in hexagonal grid
Minimum sampling distance for points in hexagonal grid
Scale factor for volume filled by trace molecule from wang mask
Accessible surface area cutoff for hexagonal grid
Maximum of cycles for optimizing trace length

guiDefinition.caption: Specify the different components for which you want to search. If more than one ensemble is listed for a component Phaser will try them all as alternative models for that component.

qualifiers.toolTip: If the target you are searching for consists of more molecules specify how many of them you wish to search for.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Use partial solution from previous job
Write PDB files of ensembles to separate files for each solution
Write PDB files of coordinates used for packing
Replace scatterer type in PDB file
qualifiers.toolTip: useful for shelxd output pdb file
useful for shelxd output pdb file

qualifiers.guiLabel: Use Wilson restraint for isotropic components of atomic B-factors
Use sphericity restraint on isotropic B-factors

qualifiers.toolTip: This is the scattering types to find, which can be atomic elements, cluster compounds, or purely imaginary (type AX) or real (RX) scatterers.
Purge phassade atom list

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percent difference between top and mean solutions
Maximum number of solutions to survive purging (irrespective of percent cutoff). Set to zero to ignore.
Enable structure completion by log-likelihood gradient maps

qualifiers.toolTip: This should be a space-separated list of the scattering types to search for, which can be atomic elements, cluster compounds, or purely imaginary (type AX) or real (RX) scatterers.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Z-score for accepting peaks as new atoms
Maximum number of cycles of LLG structure completion
Type of llg maps imaginary or real+imaginary per scattering type
Refine rot/tra/bfac/vrms of last added component only
Select offset if merging not performed
Minimum fraction scattering of original model for output
Target ellg for number of residues in occupancy window
Maximum number of residues in occupancy refinement window
Number of residues in occupancy refinement window (overrides ellg target)

qualifiers.toolTip: Depending on the choice of method to filter solutions by packing, this can be either a percentage value or an absolute number.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Stop packing check when cutoff is exceeded
Pack ensembles into a compact association
qualifiers.toolTip: Minimize distances between centres of mass for the addition of each component in a solution.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Keep solutions with high TFZ even if they do not pack

qualifiers.toolTip: Determines whether phases are taken from an actual model (PDB file) or electron density.
Defines type of statistic used to describe deviation of the partial model relative to the expected structure.
Deviation of the partial model relative to the expected structure. Can be either sequence identity (as a percent value, i.e. 0 to 100) or RMSD (in Angstroms).
FC column label for partial structure HKLIN
PHIC column label for partial structure HKLIN

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percentage value to search deeper in the rotation list

qualifiers.toolTip: Purge solution list according to best solution so far at end of TF and in FULL and FAST searches after refinement step

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percent difference between top and mean solutions
Maximum number of solutions to survive purging (irrespective of percent cutoff). Set to zero to ignore.

qualifiers.toolTip: Purge solution list according to best solution so far at end of TF

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percent difference between top and mean solutions
Max. number of solutions after purging
qualifiers.toolTip: Maximum number of solutions to survive purging (irrespective of percent cutoff). Set to zero to ignore.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Purge refinement and phasing solution list

qualifiers.toolTip: Purge solution list according to best solution so far at end of TF and in FULL and FAST searches after refinement step

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percent difference between top and mean solutions
Maximum number of solutions to survive purging (irrespective of percent cutoff). Set to zero to ignore.

qualifiers.toolTip: Only applies to automatic MR and fast rotation function
Only applies to automatic MR and fast translation function

qualifiers.guiLabel: Percentage of resharpening factor to apply

qualifiers.toolTip: High resolution limit for all calculations but final refinement. Leave blank to allow Phaser to set adaptive defaults.
High resolution limit for final refinement. Reduce if available memory will be exceeded by refining at full resolution.

qualifiers.guiLabel: If the R-factor is low for ensemble at origin then abort MR
If the R-factor is below this cutoff for ensemble at origin then abort MR

qualifiers.toolTip: Setting this option to Fast mode will automatically consolidate solutions from multiple translation searches, which substantially reduces runtime for multi-copy structures. Also, if there is not a clear solution for a component, then the translation search will search deeper in the rotation list.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Refine occupancy for solutions rejected from packing at end of FAST search mode
qualifiers.toolTip: The PDB file may then have some residues with occupancies set to zero to satisfy packing criteria

qualifiers.guiLabel: Occupancy factor of search model (partial scattering)

qualifiers.toolTip: To specify a subgroup for data expansion, click on More...

qualifiers.guiLabel: Hall symbol of subgroup of data space group
qualifiers.toolTip: Hall symbol can be obtained from the log of a prior run of Phaser

qualifiers.guiLabel: Account for translational NCS if present
qualifiers.toolTip: If checked, Phaser will attempt to correct for TNCS if it has been detected based on the Patterson map.

qualifiers.guiLabel: Number of molecules or complexes related by translation vector
Supplement rotation list with rotations of known components
TNCS vector. 0,0,0 = use internally determined vector.
Perturb translation vector from patterson/input position if it is on a special position
High resolution limit for Patterson calculation
Low resolution limit for Patterson calculation
Minimum distance of Patterson peak from origin
Initial rmsd for sigmaa calculation between NCS copies
Initial fraction for sigmaa calculation between NCS copies
Sampling (degrees) around origin for initiating TNCS rotation refinements. 0 = use internally determined default.
Range (degrees) around origin for initiating TNCS rotation refinements. 0 = use internally determined default.
Use occupancy restraint for NCS related atoms
Sigma of occupancy restraint for NCS related atoms
Only add atoms to LLG gradient maps in pairs, not as single atoms
Number of top PDB files to output
Do packing test for top peaks in translation function
Do packing test for base solutions in translation function
Pairwise packing test percent for translation function
Max number peaks for packing test in translation function
Use Z-score cutoff in fast search for amalgamation of solutions
Use Z-score cutoff to terminate search
Use half the highest TFZ score as the minimum
